channel.title: How-To Geek
channel.description: We explain technology. Learn more with our articles, reviews, tips, and the best answers to your most pressing tech questions.

item.title: 6 Classic Computing Symbols That Refuse to Die
item.dc:creator: Bobby Jack
item.content:encoded: When it comes to tech fashions and trends, icons are at the forefront. From skeuomorphism to flat, icons have come a long way since Windows 3.1 and Susan Kare’s celebrated designs for the Apple Macintosh. But some trends persist, and the following icons have long outlived their real-life counterparts.

item.title: Is the iPhone 17, iPhone 17 Pro, or iPhone Air Waterproof?
item.dc:creator: Tim Brookes
item.description: Water resistant by design, with a catch.
item.content:encoded: We live in an era of water-resistant smartphones, so it should come as no surprise that Apple’s latest iPhone models are all capable of surviving in liquid to some degree. Here’s how far you can push it, and what to do if your iPhone actually gets wet.

item.title: It Took 10 Years, but Apple Is Finally Giving the Camera Hump a Name
item.dc:creator: Tim Brookes
item.description: It's no longer just a bunch of sensors and lenses, either.
item.content:encoded: Unsatisfied with inelegant terms like “lens bump,” Apple has seen fit to rebrand the iPhone 17 and Air’s thickest section as the “camera plateau.”

item.title: Real Cameras vs. Smartphones: The Surprising Truth About Image Quality
item.dc:creator: Patrick Campanale
item.description: My iPhone is great, but my dedicated camera is better.
item.content:encoded: I’m an avid photography hobbyist as well as an experienced smartphone user. The problem? My smartphone can never replace my real camera. While smartphone cameras have become absolutely fantastic, there are still several reasons why I choose to carry my real camera when I go on photography outings.

item.title: Breaking Tech: The Surprising Joy of Fixing Your Own Devices
item.dc:creator: Patrick Campanale
item.description: You have to break a few eggs to make an omelet. Or something like that.
item.content:encoded: Have you ever taken apart a piece of tech, only to break it, and then you have to figure out how to fix it? I’ve been there more times than I can count—and I absolutely love it.

item.title: I Turned My PalmPilot on for the First Time in Over 20 Years, and Honestly, I’d Buy One Today
item.dc:creator: Andy Betts
item.description: Palm was so good that Android and iOS took all of its best bits.
item.content:encoded: Switching on a PalmPilot today is like opening a time capsule. Its beeps, gray, stylus-driven screen, and simple app grid are pure nostalgia. Yet this little organizer captured the essence of mobile computing long before iPhones and Androids existed.

item.title: 10 Great Desk Accessories Under $20 That Make a Big Difference
item.dc:creator: Ismar Hrnjicevic
item.description: The smallest desk upgrades sometimes make the biggest difference.
item.content:encoded: If you're like me, your computer desk is one of the most important places, so you're always looking for ways to tweak and improve your workstation. While many desk upgrades can cost hundreds of dollars, there are plenty of small gadgets that can do a lot for your setup without breaking the bank.

item.title: 6 Compelling Reasons to Rewatch Your Favorite Movies
item.dc:creator: Sydney Butler
item.content:encoded: I don't know about you, but I'm one of those people who will watch their favorite movies multiple times. Some movies I watch every year, perhaps on special occasions, others I'll dust off every few years, or whenever I'm in the mood.

item.title: Homelab Disaster: Protect Your Data Before It's Too Late
item.dc:creator: Patrick Campanale
item.description: Seriously. Don't play with your homelab's future and just get a backup battery.
item.content:encoded: Do you have a backup battery in your homelab? I didn’t for a few years, and it was a risky move. While I didn’t suffer any data loss (thankfully), things could have turned out much different. Now? I have a backup battery deployed in my homelab to make sure I have enough time to shut things down if the power goes out.

item.title: 9 New Prime Video Shows and Movies to Watch for September 2025
item.dc:creator: Chris Snellgrove
item.description: Cool nights call for hot new movies and TV shows. Here are the latest offerings from Prime Video to keep you warm!
item.content:encoded: If you have an appetite for great entertainment, finding an awesome new movie or TV show is like pulling up to a loaded buffet. After all, hitting that “keep watching” button is like refilling your plate, again and again. And when the shows and movies are good enough, it’s hard to stop eating–er, streaming.
